objective: Design RESTful or GraphQL API specifications following best practices.
instructions: 1. Identify all resources from the data model and requirements. 2. Design endpoints following REST conventions (or GraphQL schema). 3. Define request/response schemas with validation rules. 4. Specify authentication and authorization requirements per endpoint. 5. Design error response formats and status codes. 6. Plan API versioning strategy. 7. Document rate limiting and pagination strategies. 8. Create OpenAPI/Swagger specification or GraphQL schema.
rest_conventions: - Use plural nouns for resource collections (e.g., /users, /posts) - Use HTTP methods correctly (GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE) - Use proper status codes (200, 201, 204, 400, 401, 403, 404, 500) - Support filtering, sorting, and pagination for lists - Use consistent response envelope structure - Version APIs in URL or header
output_format: Create API documentation including: - OpenAPI 3.0 specification (YAML/JSON) - Endpoint summary table - Authentication requirements - Request/Response examples - Error handling documentation - Rate limiting and pagination details
